page.title: 13Social Life
page.content: Social life in the village centres on the{Royal Oak}public house and the {Village Hall.}The eighteenth century Royal Oak is popular with local residents,holidaymakers and foreign visitors such as the New Zealand sheep shearers on working holidays. Occasionally there is some musical entertainment from a pianist and a double bass player who uses a broom stick lashed to a tea chest as an instrument.A number of{British Legion meetings are held there. The village hall is used for meetings by various organizations and private parties. Life for teenagers can be difficult, they have to go outside the village for entertainment.Young people working in Newbury need their own transport, since the first bus arrives there after 9am,too late for most jobs.
